module.name: functional_usage_view
module.keywords: module, network, functional interface, usage, terminal, group, simulation, analysis

abstract.p: the representation of information needed to describe the interface to a function and a method to represent the behaviour of the function in a computer based experiment using a simulation model external to the function detailed definition.
abstract.li: characterization of behaviour realized by one or more versions of a part or a product, or a subset of a product;
characterization of behaviour not realized by a real product but defined only for experimental purposes;
identification of the interface of a functional unit.

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of information needed to describe the interface to a function and a method to represent the behaviour of the function in a computer experiment using an external simulation model. Terminal information as well as terminal grouping is also supported. The ability to make equivalence statements about functions and function terminals is provided. The ability to state derivation relationships between functions is provided. The capability to distinguish cardinality of terminals is supported.

inscope.li: characterization of behaviour realized by one or more versions of a part or a product, or a subset of a product;
identification of the interface of a functional unit;
characterization of behaviour not realized by a real product but defined only for experimental purposes;
items within the scope of application module Analytical model, ISO/TS 10303-1603;
items within the scope of application module Product view definition relationship, ISO/TS 10303-1041.

outscope.li: the internal view of a function;
realization of the behaviour of a function in a real part.
